metadata.title: CVE-2023-5726 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A website could have obscured the full screen notification by using thefile open dialog. This could have led to user confusion and possiblespoofing attacks. *Note: This issue only affected macOS operating systems.Other operating systems are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox< 119, Firefox ESR < 115.4, and Thunderbird < 115.4.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5726` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
